tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE RobotAdjustments (
    adjustment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    adjustment_date DATE,
    adjustment_time TIME,
    adjustment_value FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES RobotCalibrationData(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE RobotLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    log_date DATE,
    log_time TIME,
    log_message TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES RobotCalibrationData(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE RobotSettings (
    setting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    setting_name VARCHAR(50),
    setting_value VARCHAR(100),
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES RobotCalibrationData(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE robot_data (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  robot_id INT NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE,
  adjustment_1 FLOAT,
  adjustment_2 FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_logs (
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  robot_id INT NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE,
  technician VARCHAR(50),
  success BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE adjustment_logs (
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  robot_id INT NOT NULL,
  date DATE,
  adjustment_type VARCHAR(50),
  value FLOAT
);
